main event: A yellow, red flaming object, elongated in shape, with no sound, appeared high and slow over Charleston, South Carolina on December 31, 1955.
interesting points: The object appeared to have an exhaust trail.
The object changed course, moving from north to vertical to the south.
The object was observed for 20-25 minutes.
A vapor trail of an aircraft passed between the observer and the object at a lower angle.
The report states it was possibly a jet aircraft or the first signs of an evening star.
sighted object: A yellow, red flaming, elongated object
witnesses: A civilian, a doctor and a housewife
